title.title: Letter from E. M. Stites to Mississippi Governor Adelbert Ames; October 31, 1875

editionStmt.edition: Edition created from new transcripts of this manuscript.

respStmt.resp: Initial upload of this work's facsimile images and metadata to FromThePage for editing
Administrator of the Civil War & Reconstruction Governors of Mississippi, Main Collection transcription project on FromThePage

msIdentifier.collection: Civil War & Reconstruction Governors of Mississippi, Main Collection

element.label: Contributors
element.value: Funding for this project provided by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission of the National Archives.

element.label: Description
element.value: From the Mississippi Department of Archives and History Governor Ames Collection. Letter from E. M. Stites to Mississippi Governor Adelbert Ames, informing him that without military protection, the African American vote will be lost in Claiborne County, Mississippi, because of voter intimidation.

element.label: Digital collection
element.value: Mississippi Department of Archives and History.

div.fw: Letter from E. M. Stites to Mississippi Governor Adelbert Ames; October 31, 1875
div.p: Editorial Note: Letter from E. M. Stites to Mississippi Governor Adelbert Ames; October 31, 1875 could not be located at the Mississippi Department of Archives and History (MDAH) for digitization at this time. Brief information about the missing document can be found below by selecting "Document Metadata" on the right hand tab beneath the document viewer, but please not that this information was based on MDAH's original itemized calendars and could not be compared against the document itself.
